Lectures.Title: Web Systems Development
Lectures.Description: Introduction to the Websys course and a review of the syllabus material.

Lectures.Title: The Basics
Lectures.Description: Network information review, setting up Github + VMs, and going over the first lab.

Lectures.Title: GitHub & Project Proposals
Lectures.Description: How to use Github, Github etiquette, and a look at group project proposals.

Lectures.Title: HTML
Lectures.Description: A overview of markup languages and how to utilize them.

Lectures.Title: CSS
Lectures.Description: An overview of CSS, including how each component works and the three main rules of inheritance, the cascade, and specificity.

Lectures.Title: JavaScript
Lectures.Description: An overview of how JS interacts with the DOM and how dynamic web pages are created.

Lectures.Title: AJAX, JSON, & APIs
Lectures.Description: An overview of AJAX calls and JSON then tying in how APIs work and how they have been standardized.

Lectures.Title: Quiz 1 Review
Lectures.Description: Everything that could possibly be on Quiz 1.

Lectures.Title: Front End Optimization and UX
Lectures.Description: A overview of website performance and potential techniques for improving it. An overview of UX and design principles.

Lectures.Title: PHP
Lectures.Description: The basics of PHP including data types, syntax, control structure, and more. Then a look at PHP Interfaces, Abstract classes, Polymorphism

Lectures.Title: PHP and MySQL
Lectures.Description: Overview of how PHP and MySQL databases interact, as well as how to develop a backend.

Lectures.Title: Authentication & Authorization
Lectures.Description: An overview of authentication and authorization, including cryptography and hashing, as well as how to secure a database from various types of attacks.

Labs.Title: Lab 1
Labs.Description: This lab will have you create a portfolio website for your group, which will include a portfolio site/page for each individual member of the group within.

Labs.Title: Lab 2
Labs.Description: Each group will make their own interactive Constitution web app/site.

Labs.Title: Lab 3
Labs.Description: Your job this week (as individuals, this is not a group lab) is to make ITWS a new site.

Labs.Title: Lab 4
Labs.Description: Create a weather and other API app using OpenWeatherMap API and any API of your choice.

Labs.Title: Lab 6
Labs.Description: We are going to optimize a game I made called Free Bee. You will need to implement at least 7 optimizations.

Labs.Title: Lab 7
Labs.Description: Create an interactive web page that will allow users to interact with data from your MySQL database.
